column4: Hey, what is a good place to look to see dependencies for, say, openbox and chromium web browser? I am installing ubuntu minimal on a box that requires a log-in via browser (i don't know any other way to authenticate with the network)
Or is there an all-inclusive way to install elinks on top of ubuntu minimal?
apt-get install elinks
that would require me to have authenticated with the network--which I can't do right off unless I have a browser, so I have to have the packages handy
you might have w3m installed
is that a browser similar to elinks?
somewhat
does it handle cookies?
yup
failing that, if you have no other option there's always netcat and the HTTP protocol
Can you give me some idea as to how that would work?
what exactly? HTTP? see the protocol RFC
netcat [HOST] [PORT] and there you go
I hope you have elinks there
or links at least
if not then you're better off copying the deb to there and installing some browser
elinks would be sufficient, but I dont think it comes with ubuntu minimal install :-D
you have to get any browser on your system, I don't think you'd feel comfortable with writing HTTP requests by hand
it would be an experience, for sure
download it from packages.ubuntu.com, put it on a pendrive along with all dependencies, and install with dpkg from there
you rock man, I appreciate it
thanks for your help
